comments.body: Once the filesource or validation logic is moved to Validate(), can we add some unit tests for Validate()?
Added unit tests no username, no password and no server

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +25,29 @@)

func TestCreateSecretDockerRegistry(t *testing.T) {
	username, password, email, server := "test-user", "test-password", "test-user@example.org", "https://index.docker.io/v1/"
	secretData, err := handleDockerCfgJSONContent(username, password, email, server)

comments.body: Can we improve those unit tests to contain also some fake fileSources, and test beween fileSources or Username, and the handling of the JSON?

OK, I was thinking that kubectl create secret parsed the dockercfg but I was wrong :)

Anyway, I would like to test this case: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/98614/files#diff-515e663fc601270fd240da46a29b12cb47ec262d0f952269651639b09ce75336R280-R284

Yup, I didn't add any test cases because the function that handles fileSources will be called from create_secret.go and create_secret_test.go will handle that. Unless you want to migrate some of the test cases from there?
